Name: Highland Sazerac
Ingredients: 5 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
15 ml Speyside single malt Scotch whisky
7.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
3 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
POUR Chartreuse into glass and twirl to coat inside with liqueur.
Fill glass with ice and set aside.
Separately, STIR other ingredients with ice in mixing glass.
DISCARD contents of glass (Chartreuse and ice).
FILL Chartreuse-coated glass with fresh ice and STRAIN contents of mixing glass.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A dash of malt gives a Highland influence to the Sazerac, also given a herbal note due to a generous splash of Chartreuse.
History: Adapted from a recipe crearted by Don Lee at PDT in New York City, USA. Don's original recipe calls for yellow Chartreuse. Sazerac cocktail history
Nutrition: One serving of Highland Sazerac contains 177 calories
